page.title: 20 SUMMARY
page.content: Faversham,while aware of its past is not always limited by it.Once an important market town and port it functions today as a low order service centre. Shopping is dominated by convenience goods and there is intense competition from other towns.Some fear that Faversham is becoming a village, although market stalls have brought some hustle back to the centre. Industry,once varied and important is now declining but the breweries still thrive.Population growth is slow, limited by the Kent structures plan,and the town remains on the fringe of the commuter belt. Much has been done to preserve the past in Faversham but LONDON still has a strong influence on the town that lies in a rich fruit and vegetable belt between the down and the marshes.
